profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born near Lancaster, Garrard County, Ky., March 2, 1802; pursued preparatory studies; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1823 and commenced practice in Lancaster, Ky.; member of the State house of representatives 1828, 1829, 1832, and 1836-1838; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-sixth Congress and served from March 4, 1839, until his death near Lancaster, Garrard County, Ky., August 11, 1840; interment in the Anderson family cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Charles Lanman Collection, 1819-1895, 1 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The collections contains an autobiographical or biographical sketch of Simeon Anderson. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.
